descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: "Haptics" refers to the perceptual system associated with touch. In this course, students will examine what happens when a finger touches and moves relative to a surface, both in terms of the mechanical consequences of that touch and the neural and cognitive processes that result. In addition, students will be introduced to a variety of technologies for haptic interface.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: All students will be responsible for reading and presenting scholarly papers, and for working with a partner to conceive, design and execute a research project.
